See also: Baden, badén, and båden

Catalan[edit]

Verb[edit]

baden

  1. third-person plural present indicative form of badar

Dutch[edit]

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈbaːdə(n)/
  • Audio
    		(file)
  • Hyphenation: ba‧den
  • Rhymes: -aːdən

Etymology 1[edit]

From Middle Dutch bāden, from Old Dutch bathon, from Proto-Germanic *baþōną.

Verb[edit]

baden

  1. (ergative) to bathe
Inflection[edit]

Derived terms[edit]
  • badderen

Etymology 2[edit]

See the etymology of the main entry.

Verb[edit]

baden

  1. plural past indicative and subjunctive of bidden

Noun[edit]

baden

  1. plural of bad

Anagrams[edit]

  • bande

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Old High German badōn, from Proto-Germanic *baþōną.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈbaːdən/
  • audio (Germany)
    		(file)
  • audio (Austria)
    		(file)

Verb[edit]

baden (third-person singular simple present badet, past tense badete, past participle gebadet, auxiliary haben)

  1. to bathe

Middle Dutch[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Old Dutch bathon, from Proto-Germanic *baþōną.

Verb[edit]

bāden

  1. to bathe, to wash

  • Dutch: baden
  • Limburgish: bejje

Swedish[edit]

baden
